intro: Achyronia sarcantha, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves and thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. It is often found in coastal dunes and other arid environments. Achyronia sarcantha is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
